body:
That's exactly the same :) When we add `user:pass` to the URI as userInfo, Apache http client (which is used by jcabi-http) is converting this data into `Authorization` header. This `user:pass` information is used in the URI only on the client side. The server doesn't see it in the URI.

What is the problem you're getting? You can't authenticate with Github?
I cannot authenticate without first injecting my own constructed `Authentication` header that matches what I usually use with curl.
How do you inject it? Can you post your code that works?

I use

``` groovy
rt_req = rt_req.header(
            HttpHeaders.AUTHORIZATION,
            String.format("Basic %s", EncodingGroovyMethods.encodeBase64("$user:$pass".getBytes()))
        )
```

With rt_req being a `Request` object.

(Note: this is in groovy, although I am not sure this changes things)
and if you use `RtGithub(user, pass)` - it doesn't work?
That is what I pass to create the Request and it does not work.

Wait a sec, how about just this (in Groovy):

```
def github = new RtGithub(user, pass);
```

Don't touch/change the request. Just pass user and password as arguments of the ctor. Doesn't it work?
I'm trying to create a release; and not changing the request gives me a 404 Not Found.
Also, my rate limit is kept at the base 60.
Hm, this could be a bug in our library, since we don't have a unit test covering this use case. Let us investigate...
I'm aware of the task, give me some time to find a developer...

@kenzierocks , @yegor256 , this bug is confirmed. At the moment, when we use the constructor `new RtGithub(user, password)`, it does not set the `Authorization` header to the HTTP Basic format. Instead, it sends a request to the URI `https://user:password@api.guthub.com` which is not accepted by the Github API. The behavior is the same when I use `JdkRequest` instead of `ApacheRequest`. 

When I add the `Authorization` header to the request instead, my credentials do get accepted. So I'll change the code appropriately, I'll submit a patch soon.
Pull request has been created at #816, please review.
@kenzierocks , we've merged a patch in #816, are we good here?
this fix was released in [version 0.9.1](https://github.com/jcabi/jcabi-github/releases/tag/jcabi-0.9.1) to Maven Central
